means: 紧张的，可能引起激烈反应的

sentence.Network_cn: 他被控谋划妨碍司法公正。

sentence.Network_en: He charged into the crowd. "Break it up," he shouted.
sentence.Network_cn: 他冲进人群，大喊道：“散开。”

sentence.Network_en: In an emotionally charged speech, he said he was resigning.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一次煽情的演讲中，他说他要辞职。

entry.tran: (形势)紧张的，引起强烈感情的
entry.def: If a situation is charged, it is filled with emotion and therefore very tense or exciting.

example.ex: There was a highly charged atmosphere...
A wedding is an emotionally charged situation.
example.tran: 婚礼是个让人动情的场合。

entry.def: Charged particles carry an electrical charge.

means.word_mean: 1. of a particle or body or system; having a net amount of positive or negative electric charge;
4. capable of producing violent emotion or arousing controversy;
